::Prowl::

Prowl's eyes narrow, the bot beginning to feel his temper building.

"First, I did not lead the battle. I'm not the commander here. Second, we did not get mopped. The CF has been through more battles than you can possibly imagine, and its a miracle it even held as long as it has."

He glances over at the rest of the Maximals, pausing on Klant and Torca. "With every other faction on the planet fighting against us, its a bit hard to survive, but we're holding on. Iron Raptor is trying to change that, and is succeeding. But if you don't believe we can change, then go ahead and give up."

With a final growl, he turns around. "And you call yourselves Maximals."

It wasn't in Prowl's character to get pissed off like that, but Iron Raptor had affected him more than he knew. He makes a mental note to learn how to control this new temper in the future as he walks back toward Maximal City.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., robertdahl <rdahl@t...> wrote:
> Cliffjumper gritted his teeth. "Don't you talk to me like that. You may
> have the name of Prowl, but you acted nothing like him on the battle
> field." Cliffjumper said accusingly. His eyes widdened with rage. "I've
> been around enough to know what will, and won't work, and you my friend
> don't work. You proved it with how you led the battle, and the maximals
> got mopped. Then you even helped nail some of your own, by letting the
> auto cannons fire, and other blunders like that. I don't believe you
> guys can change."
> 
> Firedrill looked on, pain in his eyes. He couldnt stand to see this kind
> of thing, and was torn between a mentor, and a new friend.
